source.citation: Borz, S.A. et al. 2023. Bucking at Landing by a Single-Grip Harvester: Fuel Consumption, Productivity, Cost and Recovery Rate. Forests 14:465.
notes: 27 cable-delivered bunches (232 stems, 913 logs) processed at a Romanian landing using a Ponsse Bear harvester.
Work cycles averaged 1.5 min; productive share ≈79 %, with swinging and piling accounting for 86 % of productive time.
Efficiency 0.047 PMH/m³ (≈0.053 SMH/m³); productivity 21.41 m³/PMH (18.81 m³/SMH); recovery rate 95 %.
Fuel 21 L/h (0.78 L/m³); cost simulations (200–230 working days/year) yielded 10–11 EUR/m³ at 2023 price levels.
